title: Exemple: Infographie Theoreme de Pythagore
style: Clean educational infographic, white background, blue and orange color scheme, sans-serif fonts, numbered sections
prompt:
TITLE: 'LE THEOREME DE PYTHAGORE - Tout comprendre en une image'

LAYOUT: Landscape format, divided into 4 main zones:
- Central zone (50%) with triangle and main formula
- Left zone for conditions
- Right zone for derived formulas
- Bottom zone for worked example

CENTRAL ZONE:
- Large right triangle ABC clearly drawn
- Right angle at C marked with small red square
- Sides labeled: 'a' (opposite to A), 'b' (opposite to B), 'c' (hypotenuse)
- Main formula in large box: 'a² + b² = c²'
- Annotation pointing to hypotenuse: 'Hypotenuse = longest side, opposite the right angle'
- Visual: Small squares built on each side showing geometric proof

LEFT ZONE - CONDITIONS:
- Title: 'When to use it?'
- Icon: Triangle with question mark
- Bullet list:
  • 'RIGHT triangle ONLY'
  • 'To calculate a side length'
  • 'To verify if triangle is right-angled'
- Light blue background

RIGHT ZONE - DERIVED FORMULAS:
- Title: 'The 3 formulas'
- Formula 1: 'c = √(a² + b²)' with arrow 'find hypotenuse'
- Formula 2: 'a = √(c² - b²)' with arrow 'find a leg'
- Formula 3: 'b = √(c² - a²)' with arrow 'find other leg'
- Light orange background

BOTTOM ZONE - EXAMPLE:
- Title: 'Worked Example'
- Triangle with values: a=3, b=4, c=?
- Step-by-step calculation: 'c² = 3² + 4² = 9 + 16 = 25, so c = 5'
- Result in green box: 'c = 5'
- Small checkmark icon

VISUAL ELEMENTS:
- Arrows connecting zones showing flow
- Icons: calculator, ruler, set square
- Consistent color coding
- Clear visual hierarchy
